bibliography.AU: Herranz, D; Bonell, F; Gomez-Ibarlucea, A; Andrieu, S; Montaigne, F; Villar, R; Tiusan, C; Aliev, FG
bibliography.AF: Herranz, D.; Bonell, F.; Gomez-Ibarlucea, A.; Andrieu, S.; Montaigne, F.; Villar, R.; Tiusan, C.; Aliev, F. G.
bibliography.TI: Strongly suppressed 1/f noise and enhanced magnetoresistance in epitaxial Fe-V/MgO/Fe magnetic tunnel junctions
bibliography.DE: 1; f noise; iron; iron alloys; magnesium compounds; tunnelling magnetoresistance; vanadium alloys
bibliography.AB: Alloying Fe electrodes with V, through reduced FeV/MgO interface mismatch in epitaxial magnetic tunnel junctions with MgO barriers, notably suppresses both nonmagnetic (parallel) and magnetic (antiparallel) state 1/f noise and enhances tunneling magnetoresistance. A comparative study of the room temperature electron transport and low frequency noise in Fe1-xVx/MgO/Fe and Fe/MgO/Fe1-xVx magnetic tunnel junctions with 0 inf x sup 0.25 reveals that V doping of the bottom electrode for x infs 0.1 reduces in nearly two orders of magnitude the normalized nonmagnetic and magnetic 1/f noise. We attribute the enhanced TMR and suppressed 1/f noise to strongly reduced misfit and dislocation density. (C) 2010 American Institute of Physics. [doi: 10.1063/1.3430064]
bibliography.C1: [Herranz, D.; Gomez-Ibarlucea, A.; Villar, R.; Aliev, F. G.] Univ Autonoma Madrid, Dpto Fis Mat Condensada, CIII, E-28049 Madrid, Spain; [Bonell, F.; Andrieu, S.; Montaigne, F.; Tiusan, C.] Univ Nancy 1, CNRS, Inst Jean Lamour, F-54506 Vandoeuvre Les Nancy, France
